snippet: The bill, which passed with a large enough majority to override an expected veto, will initially require New York businesses with at least 20 employees to pay for five sick days.
abstract: New York City Council approves bill, 45 to 3, that will require many businesses to offer paid time off to sick employees; passage of bill, subject of years of impassioned debate, is result of compromise between Speaker Christine Quinn, who had long held up vote on measure, and bill's advocates, which include powerful unions.
lead_paragraph: The bill, which passed with a large enough majority to override an expected veto, will initially require New York businesses with at least 20 employees to pay for five sick days.

headline.seo: New York Council Approves Paid Sick-Leave Measure
headline.main: City Council Approves Bill Mandating Sick-Day Pay
headline.print_headline: City Council Approves Bill Mandating Sick-Day Pay
